title.native: ヴァイオレット・エヴァーガーデン 外伝~永遠と自動手記人形~
title.romaji: Violet Evergarden Gaiden: Eien to Jidou Shuki Ningyou
title.english: Violet Evergarden: Eternity and the Auto Memory Doll

description:
Violet Evergarden comes to a private women's academy to tutor Isabella in the ways of being a lady. Heir to the York family, Isabella feels trapped in this new and uncomfortable world. She still grieves for the only person to ever bring her happiness – now lost to her. Violet's lessons do give her a brief respite from the melancholy but with the absence of joy, how long does it take to truly heal?

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: Violet Evergarden und das Band der Freundschaft
Violet Evergarden Gaiden: La Eternidad y la Muñeca de Recuerdos Automáticos
Violet Evergarden Gaiden: Eternidade e a Boneca de Automemória
Вайолет Эвергарден: Вечность и призрак пера
Violet Evergarden: Věčnost a Píšící panenka

node.description: Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). He is also one of the lecturers at the studio's training school.
[Twitter](https://mobile.twitter.com/takasemaru919)
[Twitter](https://mobile.twitter.com/takasemaru919)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Residency:__ Hino City, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Berklee College of Music (Department of Film Scoring)

[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/evancall) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/evan.call.33) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0nMGbTpPx4b3h5fMG9CpWJ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/realevancall)

__Height:__ 158cm
__Nickname:__ Minorin (みのりん)

[Official Website](https://www.minorichihara.com/) | [Profile (HoriPro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/chihara) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/chiharaminori/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/minori_parade/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minori_contact) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minori_chihara/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minori_Chihara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茅原実里)

Minori Chihara is a Japanese voice actress and singer.

On April 2, 2021, she announced via her blog that she was taking an indefinite hiatus on her singing activities at the end of the year, but continuing to voice act.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
He tragically lost his life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.
Founder and representative director of Otonarium.

Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) since 1989.

Worked as an animator in the beginning of his career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)
Rin Yamamoto is a photographer and digital compositor who has been working for Kyoto Animation since 2005.

Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) since 1989.

Worked as an animator in the beginning of his career.

Mikiko Watanabe was a background artist and art director affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

She tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

Mikiko Watanabe was a background artist and art director affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

She tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.
Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Currently freelance.
Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Currently freelance.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田和美)

Kazumi Ikeda is a Japanese animator and character designer currently affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). She joined KyoAni in 1995 after graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and transferred to the studio's Osaka branch [Animation Do](https://anilist.co/studio/929/Animation-Do) when it was established in 2000.

She is best known for doing the character designs in KyoAni's anime adaptations of Key's most prominent visual novels, [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/1530/Kanon-2006/) and [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/Clannad/), marking also her debut as chief animation director on the Kanon remake.

She has no blood relationship with late [Shouko Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102736/).
Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Currently freelance.
